reviews.text: Honestly, the food was quite yummy, and I think i enjoyed my dinner here. The portions are definitely a little bit smaller than usual standards but overall quite tasty. The kam heong fish was good, it was fragrant and spicy. But I would consider asking for fish fillet instead of fish head.

Came here a few times and I think the curry fish head is really nice üëç
The sauce is just the right texture and right taste for me.
But today ordered the ÊòüÊ¥≤Á±≥Á≤â and it‚Äôs a little disappointing. The taste is ok but the bee hoon texture is quite hard and chewy.
The Ëã¶ÁìúÁÇíËõã I think not bad as well. Even thou today the chef didn‚Äôt cook the taste evenly. But I think I‚Äôll still come back to try other dish and review üòÇ

Update:
Tried the Lala bee hoon and it‚Äôs surprisingly nice plus Lala is big.

Horfun was a humongous portion at $17. Could have fed 5 people! Surprised by the wokhei in the kway tiao. Prawns were tiny, totally unlike the pics shown. Ingredients are not generous enough. Xinzhou meefen is a pass. Not enough taste. Charsiew cut too small for a good taste. Lemon chicken is too hard. Too much batter. Sauce is just passable. I miss the old stall!

Not bad to satisfy your need for local zichar... was abit salty to my liking though I asked for less salty. Still good to go!
Aircon coffeeshop. Crowded during meal times.

I admit this isn‚Äôt the best Tze char/ fish head steamboat place but eating 5/5 because it‚Äôs a rare gem in Pasir Ris!

Fish head steamboat red grouper @ $62. Fish is super fresh. Soup can be more flavourful from the start, but after some time of boiling it‚Äôs really quite good.

Highlights: sin chew bee hoon and san lou hor fun ‚Äî wok hey was amazing. Fried baby squid is a must get too!
